definitions: Used to form the past perfect tense, indicating an action completed before another past action or a specific time in the past.
Used to form the past perfect continuous tense, indicating an ongoing action in the past that was interrupted or completed by another past action.
Used in conditional sentences (third conditional) to talk about hypothetical situations in the past.
examples: She had finished her work before I arrived.
They had been waiting for hours when the bus finally came.
If I had known, I would have helped.
